data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3150291,"name":"Ethan Wilkins","username":"Ry3512","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ry3512/{size}/188529_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T02:58:47.627Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe have a blinkin that weve been trying to setup for awhile now with 12v and 5v LED’s but have continued to have problems with the PWM input from the roboRIO. The blinkin is connected to a 5 AMP breaker on our PDP with a PWM cable to a port on the roborio, but the status light blinks blue even when we have code designated for the blinkin, the code is supposed to be run like a spark max motor controller with input values from 1 to -1. My question is, are we using the wrong code and the PWM isnt detecting it, or do we have a faulty blinkin?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIf anyone has existing code in java that has worked for the blinkin, please let us know! We want to try to get working LED’s to help our drivers and our human players for our competitions.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T02:59:29.600Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":72,"reads":133,"readers_count":132,"score":386.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":427669,"topic_slug":"rev-blinkin-problems","display_username":"Ethan Wilkins","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41972,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Sharing a braincell with Kremer"},"post_url":"/t/rev-blinkin-problems/427669/1","custom_user_title":"Sharing a braincell with Kremer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3150347,"name":"Joe","username":"madisonDad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/madisondad/{size}/179562_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T04:02:10.095Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe’re using C++, but your problem sounds similar to what we ran into.  Initially we were trying to control the PWM in the RobotPeriodic, which had your result.  We moved it to TeleopPeriodic, then enabled on the driver station, and it worked.  Someone mentioned you can’t control a motor in RobotPeriodic, and since your controlling the Blinkin as a motor, it needs to be in TeleopPeriodic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eGood luck.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T04:02:10.095Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":80.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":427669,"topic_slug":"rev-blinkin-problems","display_username":"Joe","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55339,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/rev-blinkin-problems/427669/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150368,"name":"Ethan Wilkins","username":"Ry3512","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ry3512/{size}/188529_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T04:32:38.139Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThanks alot!
